subject: RE: [junit] how to get ant sysproperties
msgSnippet: ... JB s imagination parallels reality.  Java system properties only exist within the context of a single JVM instance, just like how environment variables
messageBody:
> I imagine the data is available for only the lifetime of the JVM.

JB's imagination parallels reality. Java system properties only exist
within the context of a single JVM instance, just like how environment
variables only exist within a single process (and subprocesses of that
process).

If you want to play with running all your tests in the same JVM, look
into the "fork" and "forkmode" parameters to the junit ant task.


Todd.
